website_summaries.verdict: The best deal available when it comes to tool belts. You won't find this quality for such a low price elsewhere.
cons: The pockets don't hold larger tools as well as other belts we tested, but the low price makes up for this small inconvenience

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: I work in HVAC and wear these everyday at work. I run them through the ringer and have been using them for almost a year. I bought these bags to replace the CLC bags I use to get from Home Depot 8 or so years ago. These are very close to the same bags. Those were GREAT bags. These bags are good, not great. The inner seams on the pouches wears out, creating holes. Holes equals tools falling through. Also, my Malco sheet metal hammer sometimes falls out of the hammer ring. I probably won't get these again. How this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Michael DeRusso

customer_reviews.title: Leathercraft Tool Belt Is Well Built and Meets My Needs
customer_reviews.text: We purchased one as a gift for a family member, and when I saw the quality I purchased one for myself. I am real happy with it. Please note I am a homeowner and a retired guy that helps with Habitat and other people's projects. Therefore if you are a heavy everyday user, I cannot comment on how well it will work or hold up for you. But this is certainly built well enough and has enough functionality for my use.
customer_reviews.author: DRM

customer_reviews.title: Really nice with one fatal flaw
customer_reviews.text: This tool belt would've easily scored 5 stars. I got the leather & it's a really nice belt for the price point. The description reads a fit for sizes 28- 50, or something like that. I wear a size 32 & there was no way. On the very last belt loop it fit a little loose & was a real problem with the weight of tools. Also, the excess belt ran out almost 2 ft with nowhere to fasten it to keep it from flapping around. I had to drill a new hole & cut the excess off, then cauterize the frayed end.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. Hardin

customer_reviews.title: Better than any other work belt Ove ordered for him
customer_reviews.text: Hubby loves it, it has held up very, very well. Better than any other work belt Ove ordered for him. He had to make adjustments to the belt part. He's a 32 inch waist and he had to punch an extra hole and cut some of the belt off, but you cannot tell and now it fits! I'm not going to lie I think he looks so sexy in this tool bet!
customer_reviews.author: SweetAndSalty

customer_reviews.title: this one is a great value.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made tool belt. For the old school purists who prefer quality and simplicity over “new tech fabrics and too many add-ones”, this one is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget userNC

customer_reviews.title: Tape measure pocket is way too small
customer_reviews.text: Normal size tape measure does not fit in the tape measure pocket. A metal clip or bigger pocket would be a lot more useful. Otherwise, its well built and should hopefully break in well as the leather is quite stiff.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Blake

customer_reviews.title: Gift item
customer_reviews.text: Tool belt This was a gift that looked very good. Don’t know how it will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: R. Averett

customer_reviews.title: Very good construction
customer_reviews.text: The construction appears to be well enough to last through years of use. Smells good too !
customer_reviews.author: Paula Davis Baughman

customer_reviews.title: Make it softer!  Otherwise it is top notch
customer_reviews.text: This is a great belt with only one fault and that should be corrected by usage. It is extremely stiff and actually cuts into my skin through my shirt. I had to manipulate it for an hour or so while I watched TV and that helped a lot. I am sure with use it will soften. It is high quality and has exactly the combination of tool holders I need.
customer_reviews.author: Old Sparkie

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: My husband really likes this tool belt, specifically the location of the spot for the hammer which he says is not in his way when working.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great belt, too big.
customer_reviews.text: The belt is prety solid looking seems like it would live long, with big pockets that will contain easily framing gear. I didnt have a chance to test it on field because its too big for a skinny guy as me (34" in size). In description its written that it will go from 29"-49", but in my opinion the last hole will fit about 36" size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best tool belts I own now
customer_reviews.text: One of the best tool belts I own now, loops for the hammers are perfect along with the holders for pencils. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Irving

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in design
customer_reviews.text: Am disappointed with the design because the center pouch which is where many people carry their tape measure is to small for most construction tapes
customer_reviews.author: Marvin M James

customer_reviews.title: Great tool belt
customer_reviews.text: I use it every day when setting form boards, would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Pepe

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Got this belt to do some home improvements and it appears to be holing up well. I wish the second hammer loop was a simple metal loop rather than the spring gate but that is a minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ikuo

customer_reviews.title: Would like to
customer_reviews.text: Bag broke after 2nd day of use with only 30 mins of work time on them. Would like to return
customer_reviews.author: Cay

customer_reviews.title: Great work belt.
customer_reviews.text: Well made work belt. I hade one of these for 5 years will get my money's worth from this one. Only thing belt runs big for 33" waste had to make extra holes in it.
customer_reviews.author: laurence kerr-luceo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit smallish waists
customer_reviews.text: Says fits 29 inch + waist. Have a 32 inch waist on a good day and am swimming in this belt. Well put together tool belt but could use another ring on the belt. Now will have to get suspenders to support it
customer_reviews.author: Tom S.

customer_reviews.title: Not what i expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this work apron as a professional carpenter. It was not what I needed, but seemed of good quality. The tape measure pocket was too small to hold any size fat max tape and the pouches were fixed to the tool belt. I wear my tool belt with the bags in the back and they must be adjustable in order for the tool bag to work sufficiently for me. If you wear your apron with the bags in the front then this one seems like it would be a good choice. Just wasnt what i expected and nothing in the description indicated that the bags were riveted to the belt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great belt except for center pouch!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool belt except the tape measure pouch in the center is designed too small. It is difficult to get a standard tape measure out. Wish it was a bigger pouch for this. The rest of it is done very well.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Burgess

product_meta.title: CLC Custom Leathercraft 175274 Heavy Duty Top Grain Leather Construction Work Apron & Hammer Loop, 12 Pocket
product_meta.description:
General contractor, carpenter, electrician, construction worker, CLC Custom Leathercraft makes an apron or combo that will fit your need. Packed with features, CLC's tool belts are depended upon by more tradesmen than any other brand. They appreciate CLC's quality, value, and features, like the patented pouch handles, the gusset pocket design and the wide variety of pouches, belts and tool holders. CLC Custom Leathercraft is always thinking about how the job gets done, and build their belts accordingly. CLC's 175274 work apron is a premium quality construction work apron with a 2-Inch wide web belt along with a roller buckle and 4 main pockets with 8 smaller pockets and sleeves. This apron includes a swinging hammer loop.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
There's a CLC Combo and Apron that's custom designed to hold the tools you need for the jobs you do. Made right and made tough out of top materials. With rugged buckles that won't buckle under pressure.
feature_bullets: Made of reversed heavy-duty leather with double gussets keep front pockets for easy access
12 total pockets: 4 main nail and tool pockets and 8 smaller pockets for nail sets, pencils, and pliers
2-Inch Poly web belt with roller buckle

specifications.Style: Top Grain Heavy Duty Leather - 12 pockets
